meanings.definition: To wrap or envelop something tightly.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed inswathing the gift in colorful paper.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar was inswathing itself in a silky cocoon.
meanings.sent3: The magician inswathed the audience in a cloud of mystery.
meanings.sent4: The fog inswathing the city gave it a mystical aura.
meanings.sent5: The spider inswathing its prey in silk was a fascinating sight.

meanings.sent1: The inswathing bandages provided support to his injured arm.
meanings.sent2: The inswathing vines covered the ancient ruins completely.
meanings.sent3: The inswathing blanket made her feel cozy and secure.
meanings.sent4: The inswathing fog created a dreamy atmosphere in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The inswathing embrace of the mother was comforting to the child.
